Erengrad
Erengrad
Fearfrost
Magically forged by Khan-Queen Miska, this sword is imbued with powerful ice magic.
The Khan-Queen's Sword

This blade has been passed down through the ages from Tzarina to Tzarina, Mother to daughter, since Miska gave it to her daughter Shoika. In keeping with this time honored tradition, the blade is now yours.
May my enemies fall as Miska's did.
Rebellious Erengrad

The important trade city of Erengrad rebelled against their suzerain ruler in Kislev durning the civil war during the succession crisis several decades ago. While they have made no claims of being above the [Root.GetTitle], they have set a dangerous precedent for other would-be secessionists. Their continued refusal to submit willingly has only served to inflame tensions.\n\nWhile we are justified in launching a punitive expidition, the burghers may yet convince us to accept their pretense of self-rule.
The rebellious burghers have defied my will for too long!
Their coin could make a very convincing argument.
Fate of the Erengrad Veche

The center of Republican rule in Erengrad has long been its Veche, the seat of their burgher republic. As a powerful symbol of their popular rule, and the administrative heart of their republic, destroying it will break their will and discourage any further discussion of self-rule. However, allowing them to retain it will be seen as a gesture of the [Root.GetTitle]'s mercy, and will do much to cement their loyalty to the [Root.GetTitle] in Kislev.
The Veche burns. Their defiance cannot go unpunished.
The Veche shall remain at the pleasure of the [Root.GetTitle].
The Kislevite Ultimatum

The ignoble sovereign in Kislev has given us the option to pay a bribe or risk their might. While there is reason to believe that such threats are baseless posturing, a refusal still risks the independence of our Republic.
Our continued independence is worth a few coins.
This is an outrage!
Threats Pay Off

The burghers of Erengrad have agreed to pay us a hefty sum to ensure that they remain independent. While they are certainly not happy about being forced to part with any coin, our threat of our invasion no longer stands.
I made them an offer they couldn't refuse.
Erengrad Unmoved

The arrogant burghers of Erengrad have foolishly denied your just demand. In response to your most humble request, the patricians of the city have replied only with insults and affronts to your dignity as their rightful suzerain.
Their folly will soon be made clear to them.
For a long time we Gospodars ruled here and we shed our blood with other people of these lands. The time has come to unite with them and create new great Kislev!
Let there be one nation, one people!
Gospodars, Ungols and other people of Kislev once divided are now creating family bonds and adopting new identity.
Excellent!
More and more people in Kislev are adopting new identity. Some of courtiers also embraced new ways.
Excellent!
Whole realm has adopted new Kislevarin. My servants inform me that it is increasingly popular to show new customs and speak new Kislevarin amongst Ungol and Gospodar Boyars and Szlachta...
Excellent!
My wise liege has persuaded me to adopt new customs and new identity - I am not Gospodar or Ungol now I've become Kislevite!
It was about time.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Gryphon Legion in their struggle against enemies of Kislev. Gryphon Legion is an elite winged lancers company. They fight as mercenaries in whole Old World, still they are fiercly loyal to Kislev and always defend it when situation demands it.
Make us proud!.
Absolutely not!
[This.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a battle brother of Gryphon Legion.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is disappointed.
In his wisodm your liege allowed you to leave court for Gryphon Legion.
Your didn't give you permission to join Gryphon Legion.
Cursed fool!

column1: # After birth ceremony Dazh grants protection

column2: In Kislev every newborn infant is to be commended to the protection of Dazh. It is expected of you to follow the ancient tradition, prepare the ceremonical fire and invite most important memebers of the holding to the ceremony.
Tradition is everything!
Nonsense!

Guest have gathered and ceremony started. Together with child's mother you pass baby through the flames of ceremonial fire symbolically burning away any bad luck or Chaos taint... as you do it baby starts crying - a sign of a good luck! Dazh has granted your child his protection!

The ceremony starts and whole court has gathered witness it. Together with child's mother you pass baby through the flames of fire symbolically burning away any bad luck or Chaos taint... as you do it the mother notices that baby is noticeably burned! Bad luck! Dazh refused to granted your [From.GetBestName] his protection!

Ceremony is starting, and courtiers gathered to witness it. You stand by fire and passing baby through the flames to its mother, symbolically burning away any bud luck or Chaos taint... Suddenly baby slips from your hands directly into flames, it must be sign from Dazh, baby is tainted with Chaos! You are restrained and there is nothing you can do to help!
Dazh be praised!
Gods have forsaken us!
Nooooo! My baby!

Living so far north brings the danger of Chaos corruption. Among Ungols it is the Wise Woman whp guard tribe against taint and dispose of those touched by Chaos. A Wise woman of your tribe came to see your child. During ceremony she will check if newborn is free from influence of Chaos...
Let spirits be merciful!

Hag declared that child carries chaos taint and has to be removed from Stanitsa. In northern regions the Chaos threat is all to real and no one dares to oppose the Wise Women. It is last time you see your baby [chaos_tainted.GetBestName], Hag will take it and now there's nothing to do but mourn.
Gods be praised! A stanitsa Hag found not taint in your child! Yet, before leaving she marked your baby with Curse: [chaos_tainted.GetHagsCurse]
Gods why!?
So be it
Never! We will not allow it!
This child's finger must never bear rings
This child is cursed to never swear or curse!
Never allow this child to clutch a babe.
Cursed, is this child, to never skin rabbit, fox nor bear neither.
This child must never drink from skull or horn.
Never allow this child to be alone in the mountains!
This child must not contradict mother, grandmohter or any wise woman.
Forbidden, is this child, from fishing when Dazh blazes.
